apps.author: ImranR98
apps.name: Obtainium
apps.changeLog:
## Note

APKs with the `f-droid` label should be ignored for now. See:
* https://github.com/ImranR98/Obtainium/issues/30
* https://gitlab.com/fdroid/fdroiddata/-/merge_requests/12514

## What's Changed
* Update de.json by @DwainZwerg in https://github.com/ImranR98/Obtainium/pull/1339
* Update vi.json by @teaminh in https://github.com/ImranR98/Obtainium/pull/1338
* Translation: pt update by @jont4 in https://github.com/ImranR98/Obtainium/pull/1337
* By @ImranR98 in https://github.com/ImranR98/Obtainium/pull/1349:
  * Allow existing '/refs' in SourceHut URLs (#1347)
  * Revert to showing App URL separately again (#1336)
  * F-Droid: Don't pull changelog text if it isn't a raw file from GitHub/GitLab (#1340)
  * Add a note on self-hosted instances of sources (#1342)
  * versionCode changes


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ImranR98/Obtainium/compare/v1.0.0...v1.0.1

apps.author: weihuoya
apps.name: Citra
apps.changeLog:
**Before:**
emulator directory: "citra-emu"

**Antutu**:
package name: com.antutu.ABenchMark
This is tricking the os thinks it's running a benchmark app, and will boost performance on some device.

**Storage Access:**
emulator directory: "Android/data/org.citra.emu/files/citra-emu"
WARNING uninstall citra will remove directory, include games, dlcs, save datas.

directory: "citra-emu\nand\data\00000000000000000000000000000000\sysdata\00010026\00000000\CEC"
Delete this directory if game could not works as before.

**Try reset settings** if game does not work properly.

apps.author: Vita3K
apps.name: Vita3K
apps.changeLog:
Android v10 Changelog (non exhaustive list):

- Fix crash on Android 14 (thanks to Kazuki/Adrien for their help)
- Graphical fixes for double buffer (fix the rendering in Terraria)
- Fix some io-related Android specific crashes
- Implement asynchronous shader compilation: reduces significantly stutter caused by shader compilation (at the cost of temporary graphical glitches) and speed up by 2x-3x shader compilation time
- Shader performance improvements
- Fix some performance regressions from v9

PC rebase:

- Use guest pointer for the gxm alloc space, allows FIFA to go ingame with native buffer / page table (Macdu)
- gxm and renderer refractoring (bookmist)
- Improce codec/renderer YUV support, fixes the FMV in Ys origin (Macdu)
- Plenty of shader fixes: Fix graphical issues in 2D ubisoft games (child of light, Rayman) (Macdu)
- Fix kernel thread end callback, allows Tearaway to go ingame (Macdu)
- Page align the stack top, allows spiderman to go ingame (Macdu)
- Decrease the rendertarget size, allows Killzone to go ingame (Macdu)
- Update Indonesia/Malaysia translation (Croden, kitakata, darkhash)
- Update Japanese translation (nishinji)
- Plenty of other shader fixes: Fix GPU crash in Spiderman and Exist archive (Macdu)
- Rewrite TransferCopy: performance improvements and fix graphics in Spiderman (Macdu)
- Fix a gxm softlock, allow Unit 13 to go ingame (Macdu)
- Happy new year! (ExtremeExploit)

apps.author: langerhans
apps.name: OdinTools
apps.changeLog:
### OdinTools 1.0.1

This is a massive new release with lots of improvements to the existing code and per-app override config for controller settings!

### How per-app settings work
OdinTools will constantly monitor which app is currently in foreground. Once it detects an app that it has a configured override for it save the current settings for later and will apply the settings made in that override. 
Any time an app comes into foreground that has no defined overrides OdinTools will apply the satte it previously saved.

### How to use per-app controller settings
Navigate to the new App overrides screen and select Add app override. A Dialog will list all your app (alphabetically). Pickt eh one you would like to define an override for:

![Screenshot_20240127-190125](https://github.com/langerhans/OdinTools/assets/5160000/636a753b-2985-40cc-8107-80e922916564)

Select the overrides you would like to apply and click Save:

![Screenshot_20240127-190340](https://github.com/langerhans/OdinTools/assets/5160000/9b5a1a2f-823a-40fc-bc63-6590c99fbd8e)

To edit existing overrides just select the app in the App overrides screen. Here you are also able to delete existing overrides:

![Screenshot_20240127-190135](https://github.com/langerhans/OdinTools/assets/5160000/9f9db3a2-d9a8-4527-aaa0-d52cf8a4f6d0)

⚠️ **Note** ⚠️
This feature works by using an accessibility service to monitor which app is currently in foreground. Android will occasionally ask you to review active accessibility services. Make sure to not disable the OdinTools service or otherwise per-app overrides will stop working. OdinTools does not actually "view or control your screen" as stated in said notification. That's just the default text the system uses.

![Screenshot_20240122-222951](https://github.com/langerhans/OdinTools/assets/5160000/0df8f5f3-c864-4a73-a7aa-e5aff31eda4c)

apps.author: TapiocaFox
apps.name: Daijishou
apps.changeLog:
# 1.4.0 The Essential Features Update
**⚠️ DO NOT USE THE APK unless it is necessary!!! 
Installation size will be significantly larger (X8) then Play Store. The apk aims for universal distribution.**

Below are the features that have been modified or added.
- Disjoint Set.
- Genres.
- Synchronization.
- Backup And Restore.
- DSESS and Libretro Scraper.
- Wallpaper.
- Adaptive Color Theming.
- Logger And Daijishou Console.
- For more information view the [release note](https://github.com/magneticchen/Daijishou/blob/main/release-notes/1_4_release_note.md).

# 1.4.67
 - Fixed RSS crashes.

# 1.4.66
 - Updated Libretro domain.
 - Updated RAWeb to 4.0.1.

# 1.4.65
 - Updated experimental.
 - Fixed widget page option.
 - Upgraded RSS component.
 - Upgraded RAWeb to 4.0.0.

# 1.4.64
 - Fixed typos.
 - Upgraded components.
 - Updated experimental.
 - Improved navigation and fragments.
 - Improved RetroAchievements when you have too many friends.
 - Updated Libretro domain.
 - Updated YouTube DSESS.

# Previews

![appearance_wallpaper](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22817012/222482911-27b9f30b-0f6f-4d27-b46f-10301affdc23.png)
> Wallpaper.


![appearance_general](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22817012/222482948-62d6f20c-6e19-4381-805e-d65d28390b51.png)
> Adaptive Color theming.


![library_disjoint_sets](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22817012/222482992-dbf1c27d-4703-4e2d-b2e7-3ff4c405e05c.png)
> Disjoint Set.


![library_backup_and_restore](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22817012/222483023-a62e3317-ccef-4a0d-960d-df1277e6ff8a.png)
> Backup And Restore.

apps.author: flyinghead
apps.name: flycast
apps.changeLog:
## What's New
* Naomi F355 multiboard
* Sega SystemSP emulation
* Virtua Fighter 4 RFID card support. VF.Net emulation server
* Naomi touchscreen (Manic Panic Ghosts, Touch de Uno 1 & 2, Touch de zunou)
* Hopper for Kick'4'Cash, Shootout Pool and Club Kart Prize
* F355 Deluxe and Touch de Uno 1 & 2 printer
* Sega Driving Simulator
* Android Scoped Storage
* SH4 under/overclock option
* Mushiking series
* Naomi Alien Front worldwide ranking server
* NetDIMM 3.7 networking high-level emulation
* Racing Controller, Fishing Controller, Maracas, Densha de Go controller, Pop'n'Music Controller (@AltoRetrato)
* Real time Video Routing for streamers (@vkedwardli)
* SystemSP RFID chip emulation: Dinosaur King, Love & Berry
* Dreamcast 32 MB RAM option (@cepawiel)

## What's Improved
* Support for Windows CE games on 32-bit x86 arch
* Hotkeys for Save and Load State
* Force feedback info netcast to Boomlangnz's FFB plugin: F355, 18 Wheeler, Club Kart, King of Route 66
* Use a gamepad with arcade lightgun games
* Per-game VMU A1 option
* Improved detection of Windows CE games
* Latin-1 and Asian fonts support in HLE BIOS
* Video centering support (San Francisco Rush 2049, Street Fighter III - 3rd strike, Metropolis Street Racer)
* Daytona USA networking
* Eldorado Gate 4 to 7 compatibility
* Implement dithering in Full Framebuffer Emulation mode
* Upgrade dependencies, build improvements, and more thanks to @scribam 
* And many, many, many bug fixes thanks to @kihato and all bug reporters

## New Contributors
* @namtsui made their first contribution in https://github.com/flyinghead/flycast/pull/953
* @A-w-x made their first contribution in https://github.com/flyinghead/flycast/pull/1076
* @AltoRetrato made their first contribution in https://github.com/flyinghead/flycast/pull/1035
* @deviato made their first contribution in https://github.com/flyinghead/flycast/pull/1111
* @lhsazevedo made their first contribution in https://github.com/flyinghead/flycast/pull/1150
* @Nejsplitter made their first contribution in https://github.com/flyinghead/flycast/pull/1193
* @cepawiel made their first contribution in https://github.com/flyinghead/flycast/pull/1198

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/flyinghead/flycast/compare/V2.1...v2.2

apps.author: mmatyas
apps.name: pegasus-frontend
apps.changeLog:
## What's Changed
* Update the GitHub Actions deprecated runners by @mmatyas in https://github.com/mmatyas/pegasus-frontend/pull/1026
* Update to Qt 5.15.6 for the main targets by @mmatyas in https://github.com/mmatyas/pegasus-frontend/pull/1025
* Ignore Proton Experimental by @SpyderCoder in https://github.com/mmatyas/pegasus-frontend/pull/1038
* Fixed a possible Android error detection typo by @mmatyas in https://github.com/mmatyas/pegasus-frontend/pull/1042
* Enabled QtQuick Timeline by @mmatyas in https://github.com/mmatyas/pegasus-frontend/pull/1042
* Add 64-bit Android builds to Circle CI by @mmatyas in https://github.com/mmatyas/pegasus-frontend/pull/1052
* Updated the localizations by @mmatyas in https://github.com/mmatyas/pegasus-frontend/pull/1056
* Update OpenSSL on Android and add more builds of it by @mmatyas in https://github.com/mmatyas/pegasus-frontend/pull/1060

## New Contributors
* @SpyderCoder made their first contribution in https://github.com/mmatyas/pegasus-frontend/pull/1038

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/mmatyas/pegasus-frontend/compare/weekly_2022w30...weekly_2023w20
